V predstavi Ôs se združita slovenska in ruska kultura
06 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Ana Cukijati

Tretja letošnja predstava SNG Nova Gorica nosi naslov Ôs, podnaslov eksperimentalne predstave pa je Sanje v žanru metafizičnega solipsizma po motivih Milorada Pavića. Gre za predstavo na meji sanjskosti v koprodukciji z ruskim gledališčem Teatr Osobnjak iz Sankt Peterburga v režiji Alekseja Obrazcova. Krstna uprizoritev bo na novogoriškem malem odru drevi in jutri ob 20. uri.



Novo koprodukcijo SNG Nova Gorica in ruskega nevladnega gledališča so predstavili (z leve) dramaturginja Ana Kržišnik Blažica, koreografinja Rezeda Gajanova, igralka Maja Poljanec Nemec, režiser Aleksej Obrazcov, igralka Kristina Skvarek in prevajalec Bojan Bratina.  Foto: Ana Cukijati

NOVA GORICA > Uprizoritev po motivih zbirke zgodb Obrnjena rokavica (1989) srbskega pisatelja Milorada Pavića je nastala v koprodukciji z ruskim gledališčem Teatr Osobnjak iz Sankt Peterburga in režiji Alekseja Obrazcova s slovensko-rusko zasedbo. V različici, ki jo bodo uprizorili na malem novogoriškem odru, bodo zaigrali Kristina Skvarek iz Rusije ter Maja Poljanec Nemec in Janez Starina.
Koprodukcija dveh kultur z več sporočili
Letošnja tretja predstava SNG Nova Gorica omogoča, da se na enem odru združijo dediči dveh različnih kultur in različnih miselnosti. V središču sta igralki z navidez naključnimi podobnostmi v biografijah. A vsaka s svojimi izkušnjami in slovanskima jezikoma ustvarjata svet, ki ga je mogoče gledati, poslušati in občutiti. “Kar boste videli, ni glavno, kar vam hočemo pokazati,” je napovedal režiser.
Igralki raziskujeta in spoznavata točko ustvarjanja misli, ki ne pozna jezikovnih in socialnih ovir. “Kaj je ta os, na katero je posajen ves ta svet? Zanimivo, da je beseda os videti in slišati osirotelo,” je še dejal režiser pred drevišnjo premiero koprodukcijske predstave našega nacionalnega gledališča in ruskega nevladnega gledališča. “Glavno dogajanje se bo odvilo v glavah gledalcev in za kulisami na odru,” je še razkril.
Predstavo so ustvarjalci pripravili po motivih srbskega pisatelja Milorada Pavića. “Pri Paviću izbereš samo en stavek, ki ga lahko nato razvijaš vse življenje,” je sklenil režiser.
“Avtor je izrazito nagnjen k magičnosti. Uporablja nadrealističen način prikazovanja stvarnosti, zato je ob branju razum v breme,” pa meni prevajalec Bojan Bratina.
Predstava izhaja iz telesa, ne iz glave
“Predstava izhaja iz telesa, ne iz glave. Je brez vsakdanjih parametrov in rutine, je kot sanje - neulovljiva,” je dejala dramaturginja Ana Kržišnik Blažica. “Vrtimo se okoli iste osi, a vsak na svoj način, saj ima svak svojo os. Naj se nihče ne omejuje z omejitvami sveta in naj vsak še naprej gleda na svoj način,” je dodala osrednjo misel, ki je slovenske in ruske ustvarjalce gnala pri pripravi koprodukcije. Koreografinja in obenem pobudnica projekta je bila Rezeda Gajanova, ki je povedala, da gre za gibalno predstavo. Za razkošno kostumografijo pa je poskrbela Anis Kronidova.
Četudi se človeštvo pogreza v pravila in živimo življenje vseh prebivalcev tega sveta, le svojega ne, pa v redkih trenutkih čutimo svojo os, ki se ne ozira na ostalo človeštvo in nam govori, kam naj gledamo in kaj naj mislimo. Dialog dveh mističnih likov bo razpletel tudi mrežo iz vraževerij, ki se le na prvi pogled zdijo arhaična.
“Iracionalno gledališče v naših težkih časih združevanja in ločevanja kultur prispeva k nastanku misli o skupnosti ljudi in svetov, ki so navidez nezdružljivi,” je povedal umetniški vodja Marko Bratuš.



Ob Maji Poljanec Nemec (desno) in Kristini Skvarek bo nastopil Janez Starina, nekdanji igralec novogoriškega gledališča. Foto: Peter Uhan



Poleg igralk Maje Poljanec Nemec in Kristine Skvarek v slovenski uprizoritvi nastopa tudi Janez Starina. Foto: Peter Uhan
text:
The play ses combines Slovenian and Russian culture
06 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Ana Cukijati

The third performance of this year's SNG Nova Gorica is entitled Ôs, and the subtitle of the experimental performance is The Dream in the Genre of Metaphysical Solipsism, based on Milorad Pavić's motives. It is a performance on the border of dreaming in co-production with the Russian Theater Teatr Osobnjak from St. Petersburg, directed by Alexei Obraztsov. The baptismal staging will be on the tree stage in Novi Sad and tomorrow at 8 pm.



The new co-production of SNG Nova Gorica and the Russian non-governmental theater was presented (from left) by playwright Ana Kržišnik Blažica, choreographer Rezeda Gajanova, actress Maja Poljanec German, director Alexei Obraztsov, actress Kristina Skvarek and translator Bojan Bratina. Photo by Ana Cukijati

NOVA GORICA> Staged by a collection of stories The inverted glove (1989) by Serbian writer Milorad Pavic was produced in co-production with the Russian Theater Teatr Osobnjak in St. Petersburg and directed by Alexei Obraztsov with a Slovenian-Russian band. The version, which will be staged on a small stage in Novo mesto, will play Kristina Skvarek from Russia and Maja Poljanec German and Janez Starina.
Co-production of two multi-message cultures
This year's third performance of SNG Nova Gorica enables the heirs of two different cultures and different mindsets to unite on one stage. At the center are actresses with seemingly random similarities in biographies. But each with their own experience and Slavic languages, they create a world that can be viewed, listened to and felt. "What you will see is not the main thing we want to show you," the director announced.
The actresses explore and learn a point of thought creation that knows no linguistic and social barriers. "What is this axis upon which all this world is planted? It is interesting that the word axis is seen and heard orphaned, ”said the director before the ancient premiere of a co-production of our national theater and the Russian non-governmental theater. "The main event will take place in the minds of the spectators and behind the scenes on stage," he further revealed.
The show was created according to the motives of Serbian writer Milorad Pavic. "With Pavić you choose only one sentence that you can then develop throughout your life," the director concluded.
"The author is extremely prone to magic. He uses a surrealistic way of depicting reality, so reading is a burden, ”says translator Bojan Bratina.
The show comes from the body, not the head
"The show comes from the body, not the head. It's without everyday parameters and routine, it's like a dream - elusive, ”said playwright Ana Kržišnik Blažica. “We rotate around the same axis, but each in its own way, since each has its own axis. Let no one be confined to the limitations of the world and let everyone continue to look in their own way, ”she added. The choreographer and the initiator of the project was Rezeda Gajanova, who said that it was a movement performance. Luxurious costume design was provided by Anis Kronidova.
Even though humanity sinks into the rules and lives the lives of all the inhabitants of this world, but not our own, in rare moments we feel our axis, which ignores the rest of humanity and tells us where to look and what to think. The dialogue of the two mystical characters will also unravel a network of superstitions that at first glance seem archaic.
"Irrational theater in our difficult times of uniting and separating cultures contributes to the emergence of thoughts about a community of people and worlds that are seemingly incompatible," said artistic director Marko Bratus.



Along with Maja Poljanec German (right) and Kristina Skvarek, Janez Starina, a former actor of the Novo mesto theater, will perform. Photo by Peter Uhan



In addition to actresses Maja Poljanec German and Kristina Skvarek, the Slovenian stage also features Janez Starina. Photo by Peter Uhan
